name: Premier Inn Edinburgh City Centre - Princes Street

reviews.text: This hotel is in the perfect location for exploring the city. We have just done a mini tour of Britain and it was just the best value for it's location. Also clean and efficient friendly staff. Recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: Our visit to the Edinburgh Premier Inn on Princess Street has been fantastic. The location is brilliant and the service, rooms and breakfast were second to none. Every member of staff had a smile on their face - wonderful!
reviews.title: Edinburgh Premier Inn gets full marks

reviews.text: The view from the 5th floor overlooking the castle was fantastic. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Real value for money. The shops and resturants were all within the walking distance. Would definately return to this Hotel.
reviews.title: Girls weekend in Edinburgh

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning location and great value. The staff are friendly and helpful and the restaurant was great for breakfast. A short stroll from Waverley station and will soon have a tram stop almost outside. Usual Premier Inn room which was spotless and comfortable. I have paid a lot more in similar locations for a very much worse experience, recommended.
reviews.title: Great Value and Good Service
Good value, good location.
reviews.text: Rarely would I feel tempted to give a chain hotel a 5 star review, but the location of this place and reasonable (£80) mighty charge has persuaded me.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Excellent PI hotel in a great location for all of Edinburgh sites. Friendly staff and tidy new hotel. Highly rated. Always ask for a room at the front as great views of the castle. Breakfast very nice and staff really friendly. Will definitely be back for a future visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things:
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: 1. Location
reviews.title: Fab

reviews.text: 2. A good nights sleep
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Good enough to justify the price (amazing value). A very good choice for staying a day or two. You can walk down to the castle and the Royal Mile.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Great location on Princess Street opposite Castle. Rooms good and had everything (kettle hair dryer etc) except safe. Very clean and very pleasant staff. Had a room to leave cases which was handy the first and last days. I did not have breakfast there but some of my friends had and they really enjoyed it. I would use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Stayed in Edinburgh for the first time and very impressed with the Princes Street Premier Inn, so easy to get to from Edinburgh Waverley Station. It was close to everything and the usual ease of booking and good standard of room and cleanliness. Staff were lovely. Would stay there again. We even had a wonderful view of Edinburgh Castle from our room, the other two in the party not so lucky but an unexpected bonus. Plenty of good places to eat close to the hotel if you don't want to eat in. All in all a very enjoyable first short trip to Edinburgh. A lovely city to visit and you always know where you are with a Premier Inn.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay - Short Trip to Edinburgh

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the premier inn princess st.I booked 2 doubles and 1 family room. On arrival we where greeted by warm friendly staff who couldn't have been more helpful. Even though I only phoned the day before we travelled to ask for castle view rooms we where given two rooms with views at which we where delighted. The rooms where good size spotless and beds where very comfortable we all had a great night sleep. I only booked breakfast for one morning but we where so impressed with the buffet breakfast and great service we returned the next morning, really was great value for money. Location couldn't have been better to see everything Edinburgh has to offer. Have all ready recommended this hotel to family and friends. We would like to thank all the staff for making our family break so special and we cant wait to return.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent room, very friendly staff. The location couldn't be better, right across from the Castle and within walking distance to the central area of the city and the tour buses. Excellent stores around the hotel, very close to many restaurants. Definitely recommended! First option to stay when I go back to Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great view of the Castle

reviews.text: Couldn't find fault, ticked all the boxes, staff very friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay
Heart of Edinburgh
reviews.text: Stayed in the Premier inn on Princess street from the 2th to 23rd of Nov 2013. The Hotel is just a 5-7min walk from the waverly railway station and is directly opposite the famous Edinburgh Castle. Although we dint spend much time in the hotel and dint get a chance to dine in, but the Hotel was very nice, Clean and had all amenities one could ask for. A value for money hotel for people travelling to Scotland and are in a mood to Explore rather than stay in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight for the Previously History Fest. Welcome was friendly and very efficient. Everyone we came into contact with went out of their way to make our stay as trouble free as they could. Had a meal in the restaurant, and breakfast. Again, standards were high and staff worked hard to make us feel welcome. Would stay again without hesitation.
reviews.title: A really warm welcome with excellent service

reviews.text: I thought I knew what to expect from a Premier Inn - good value, reliable accommodation in a convenient location... But my stay at the Premier Inn on Princes Street ticked all those boxes and more! I've stayed in quite a few 4 and 5 star hotels over the years and i can honestly say that the customer service Premier Inn provided would put many of them to shame. The care and attention from every single staff member we encountered was absolutely first rate.
reviews.title: 5 star service for a 3 star budget! Fantastic!

reviews.text: We were checked in by Duty Manager Corrina who could not have been more friendly and helpful - what a great welcome. Next morning, Graham offered us a quick guided tour of the restaurant after asking if we'd dined there before - very useful. On checking out we met Charlotte who kindly dealt with our luggage etc. When we returned to collect our stuff a few hours later, she gave us a really warm welcome and had clearly remembered where we had been going to etc. Special mention would have to go to her colleague (who I think was called Adam?) - he had noticed me speaking to Charlotte in reception and spotted that I had taken my heels off (as they were rubbing my feet), so he popped over with a couple of plasters for me. It's a simple thing, but a great example of the care and attention staff there routinely devote to their guests. Completely above and beyond all my expectations!
reviews.title: Welcoming overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another area that greatly impressed me was the breakfast - we paid £8.50 each for our breakfast and weren't charged for our 4 year old daughter. I've paid double that before in a four star hotel and found that the breakfast we had in the Premier Inn was just as good, if not better! Not a huge selection, but I thoroughly enjoyed what was on offer, both continental and cooked buffets. Big thumbs up!
reviews.title: Birthday Girl

aka: Premier Inn Edinburgh City Centre - Princes Street Scotland
